channel.title: Setup Docker Context :: book.rymcg.tech
channel.description: To remotely control a Docker server, you need to create a Docker Context on your workstation, which is basically the SSH connection information to setup the docker socket connection. item.title: Create SSH config and Docker Context
item.description: To remotely control your Docker host from your workstation, you need two additional configs: SSH Host config in ~/.ssh/config. Docker Context config via docker context create .... Both of these can be created automatically by running: [bash]: Run this on your workstation: d context new This will prompt you if you really want to proceed: (stdout) ? This command can help create a new SSH config and Docker context. Proceed? (Y/n) y You can choose to create a new SSH config, or use an existing one:

item.title: Install Docker on your remote host
item.description: The base Debian image only has a few basic commands preinstalled. You must now install the Docker packages and enable the service: Choose the active Docker context d context [bash]: Run this on your workstation: d install-docker Tip d install-docker will install Docker on the remote VPS, according to your active docker context. Test that the context works from your workstation [bash]: Run this on your workstation: docker run hello-world [bash]: Run this on your workstation: docker ps

item.title: Main config for d.rymcg.tech
item.description: Select your active Docker context [bash]: Run this on your workstation: d context Each Docker context has a separate config file (.env_{CONTEXT}), stored in the root d.rymcg.tech directory (~/git/vendor/enigmacurry/d.rymcg.tech), so you must actively select your current context before you can configure it. Configure d.rymcg.tech for the current Docker context [bash]: Run this on your workstation: d make - config This will create a config file for your current Docker context, and name it .
